frontmatter.title: Simulations of mutant p53 DNA binding domains reveal a novel druggable pocket
categories: Atomistic Simulations and Design in Biology
frontmatter.description: The DNA binding domain (DBD) of the tumor suppressor p53 is the site of several oncogenic mutations. A subset of these mutations lowers the unfolding temperature of the DBD. Unfolding leads to the exposure of a hydrophobic Î²-strand and nucleates aggregation which results in pathologies through loss of function and dominant negative/gain of function effects.
